article.headline: W. Carolina 70, The Citadel 53
article.story: CULLOWHEE, N.C. -- Harouna Mutombo scored 24 points to lead Western Carolina over The Citadel 70-53 on Thursday night, snapping a three-game losing streak. Keaton Cole added 15 points and Tawaski King grabbed 15 rebounds to lead the Catamounts (11-17, 5-10 Southern Conference). The victory was just Western Carolina's second in its past nine games. Western Carolina led 34-30 at the break and outscored the Bulldogs 36-23 in the second half to seal the win. The Catamounts also outrebounded The Citadel 55-27 and forced 17 Bulldogs' turnovers. Mike Groselle finished with 17 points and pulled down 10 boards to pace The Citadel (4-22, 1-14), while Lawrence Miller added 14 points. The Bulldogs have now lost 11 straight games, with their last win coming against Samford on Jan. 4. They also have an eight-game losing skid during this campaign.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
